methods.name: AsCurrency_Float
methods.doc: Converts a passed in float to a text formatted as a currency

methods.name: AsCurrency_Integer
methods.doc: Converts a passed in integer to a text formatted as a currency

methods.name: AsCurrencyBase
methods.doc:
Generate an FText that represents the passed number as currency in the current culture.
BaseVal is specified in the smallest fractional value of the currency and will be converted for formatting according to the selected culture.
Keep in mind the CurrencyCode is completely independent of the culture it's displayed in (and they do not imply one another).
For example: FText::AsCurrencyBase(650, TEXT("EUR")); would return an FText of "<EUR>6.50" in most English cultures (en_US/en_UK) and "6,50<EUR>" in Spanish (es_ES) (where <EUR> is U+20AC)

methods.name: AsDate_DateTime
methods.doc: Converts a passed in date & time to a text, formatted as a date using an invariant timezone. This will use the given date & time as-is, so it's assumed to already be in the correct timezone.

methods.name: AsDateTime_DateTime
methods.doc: Converts a passed in date & time to a text, formatted as a date & time using an invariant timezone. This will use the given date & time as-is, so it's assumed to already be in the correct timezone.

methods.name: AsPercent_Float
methods.doc: Converts a passed in float to a text, formatted as a percent

methods.name: AsTime_DateTime
methods.doc: Converts a passed in date & time to a text, formatted as a time using an invariant timezone. This will use the given date & time as-is, so it's assumed to already be in the correct timezone.

methods.name: AsTimespan_Timespan
methods.doc: Converts a passed in time span to a text, formatted as a time span

methods.name: AsTimeZoneDate_DateTime
methods.doc: Converts a passed in date & time to a text, formatted as a date using the given timezone (default is the local timezone). This will convert the given date & time from UTC to the given timezone (taking into account DST).

methods.name: AsTimeZoneDateTime_DateTime
methods.doc: Converts a passed in date & time to a text, formatted as a date & time using the given timezone (default is the local timezone). This will convert the given date & time from UTC to the given timezone (taking into account DST).

methods.name: AsTimeZoneTime_DateTime
methods.doc: Converts a passed in date & time to a text, formatted as a time using the given timezone (default is the local timezone). This will convert the given date & time from UTC to the given timezone (taking into account DST).

methods.name: Conv_BoolToText
methods.doc: Converts a boolean value to formatted text, either 'true' or 'false'

methods.name: Conv_ByteToText
methods.doc: Converts a byte value to formatted text

methods.name: Conv_ColorToText
methods.doc: Converts a linear color value to localized formatted text, in the form '(R=,G=,B=,A=)'

methods.name: Conv_DoubleToText
methods.doc: Converts a passed in double to text based on formatting options

methods.name: Conv_Int64ToText
methods.doc: Converts a passed in integer to text based on formatting options

methods.name: Conv_IntToText
methods.doc: Converts a passed in integer to text based on formatting options

methods.name: Conv_NameToText
methods.doc: Converts Name to culture invariant text

methods.name: Conv_ObjectToText
methods.doc: Converts a UObject value to culture invariant text by calling the object's GetName method

methods.name: Conv_RotatorToText
methods.doc: Converts a rotator value to localized formatted text, in the form 'P= Y= R='

methods.name: Conv_StringToText
methods.doc: Converts string to culture invariant text. Use 'Make Literal Text' to create localizable text, or 'Format' if concatenating localized text

methods.name: Conv_TextToString
methods.doc: Converts localizable text to the string

methods.name: Conv_TransformToText
methods.doc: Converts a transform value to localized formatted text, in the form 'Translation: X= Y= Z= Rotation: P= Y= R= Scale: X= Y= Z='

methods.name: Conv_Vector2dToText
methods.doc: Converts a vector2d value to localized formatted text, in the form 'X= Y='

methods.name: Conv_VectorToText
methods.doc: Converts a vector value to localized formatted text, in the form 'X= Y= Z='

methods.name: EqualEqual_IgnoreCase_TextText
methods.doc: Returns true if A and B are linguistically equal (A == B), ignoring case.

methods.name: EqualEqual_TextText
methods.doc: Returns true if A and B are linguistically equal (A == B).

methods.name: FindTextInLocalizationTable
GetEmptyText
methods.doc: Returns an empty piece of text.

methods.name: GetTextId
methods.doc:
Attempts to get the ID (namespace and key) used by the given text.
@return True if the namespace (which may be empty) and key were found, false otherwise.

methods.name: GetTextSourceString
methods.doc:
Get the (non-localized) source string of the given text.
@note For a generated text (eg, the result of a Format), this will deep build the source string as if the generation had run for the native language.

methods.name: IsPolyglotDataValid
methods.doc:
Check whether the given polyglot data is valid.
@return True if the polyglot data is valid, false otherwise. ErrorMessage will be filled in if the the data is invalid.

methods.name: MakeInvariantText
methods.doc: Converts string to culture invariant text. Use 'Make Literal Text' to create localizable text, or 'Format' if concatenating localized text

methods.name: NotEqual_IgnoreCase_TextText
methods.doc: Returns true if A and B are linguistically not equal (A != B), ignoring case.

methods.name: NotEqual_TextText
methods.doc: Returns true if A and B are linguistically not equal (A != B).

methods.name: PolyglotDataToText
methods.doc:
Get the text instance created from this polyglot data.
@return The text instance, or an empty text if the data is invalid.

methods.name: StringTableIdAndKeyFromText
methods.doc:
Attempts to get the String Table ID and key used by the given text.
@return True if the String Table ID and key were found, false otherwise.

methods.name: TextFromStringTable
TextIsCultureInvariant
methods.doc: Returns true if text is culture invariant.

methods.name: TextIsEmpty
methods.doc: Returns true if text is empty.

methods.name: TextIsFromStringTable
methods.doc: Returns true if the given text is referencing a string table.

methods.name: TextIsTransient
methods.doc: Returns true if text is transient.

methods.name: TextToLower
methods.doc:
Transforms the text to lowercase in a culture correct way.
@note The returned instance is linked to the original and will be rebuilt if the active culture is changed.

methods.name: TextToUpper
methods.doc:
Transforms the text to uppercase in a culture correct way.
@note The returned instance is linked to the original and will be rebuilt if the active culture is changed.

methods.name: TextTrimPreceding
methods.doc: Removes whitespace characters from the front of the text.

methods.name: TextTrimPrecedingAndTrailing
methods.doc: Removes whitespace characters from the front and end of the text.

methods.name: TextTrimTrailing
methods.doc: Removes trailing whitespace characters.
